headline.main: Pierre Trudeau Is Dead at 80; Dashing Fighter for Canada

abstract: Pierre Elliott Trudeau, long-serving prime minister of Canada who successfully defended his vision of federalism and a unified nation against aroused forces of Quebec separatism, dies at age of 80; he was prime minister for nearly 16 years, serving two spans during years 1968 to 1984; his atypical flamboyance made his countrymen and women proud that Canadian was so highly visible on world stage; biographical profile; photos (L)
snippet: Pierre Elliott Trudeau, the long-serving prime minister of Canada who successfully defended his vision of federalism and a unified nation against the aroused forces of Quebec separatism, died yesterday in Montreal. He was 80.     Mr. Trudeau suffe...
